channel.title: There's something wrong with my HL:S's blood effects
channel.description: Not really a problem that doesn't allow me to continue the game but I just wanna see the blood effects... Well, the gibbing part works, the blood splashing but what I mean is whenever you shoot someone/something and blood sticks to the wall... I don't see it unless I'm about 60m away or farther (I dunno)... I just wanna see the blood

item.title: There's something wrong with my HL:S's blood effects
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
Yeah, if it doesn’t use steam, it’s pirated, I don’t care who you got it from, or even if you ‘paid’ for it. Valve is getting no money from it, so it’s an unauthorized version, and we won’t help you.
Buy it from steam, or go away.

Read full topic

item.title: There's something wrong with my HL:S's blood effects
item.dc:creator: TheHappiestGMan
item.description:
In the Original (not Source) Half-Life, the same thing has happened. You need to redo or change your DirectX. As stated by the first person to comment on this post.

Happy Headcrab Hunting! :freeman:

item.title: There's something wrong with my HL:S's blood effects
item.dc:creator: basketweaver
item.description:
True. I checked it out.

As you can read here:

Gamespy:

Q. Will the boxed versions of HL2 require any sort of Steam installations?

Doug Lombardi: During installation the user will be prompted to authenticate the copy and create a Steam account. After that is complete, the single-player and LAN games do not require an Internet connection.

So correct! My friend was wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: There's something wrong with my HL:S's blood effects
item.dc:creator: basketweaver
item.description:
Maxey:

All Valve Source games have to be played from Steam, so it’s a pirated copy.

My mate said his copy of Half Life 2 purchased when the game was first released did not require Steam, though to update it you did – a bit like Condition Zero.
Can’t verify, though, for he is halfways across the globe, just sayin’…

Read full topic

item.title: There's something wrong with my HL:S's blood effects
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
If its non-steam then I assume it’s pirated, in which case I’m not going to judge but just say that its very possible it is a poorly made pirate release, in which case either buy the game or download a different copy.

If its not pirated, then just activate it over steam and download there.

item.title: There's something wrong with my HL:S's blood effects
item.dc:creator: Hazard_Freeman
item.description:
higgsboson:

I don’t know what it could be, but I’ve had similar problems in Portal, and changing my DirectX version fixed it. Try that, in the launch options, you can change that, but Google it to know how exactly. Something like -dxlevel 81.

Could I maybe change something in the config file?

Read full topic
